1.brief: a burden; specifically, tribute, or (abstractly) porterage; figuratively, an utterance, chiefly adoom, especially singing; mental, desire
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to gaze at; mentally to perceive, contemplate (with pleasure); specifically, to have avision of

2.brief: as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
where?; hence, whither?, when?; also hither and thither
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, to be free; but used only causatively and reflexively, to halloo (for help, i.e. freedom from some trouble)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
to shriek (from anguish or danger); by analogy, (as a herald) to announce or convene publicly
near, with or among; often in general, to
violence; by implication, wrong; by meton. unjust gain
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to be open, wide or free, i.e. (by implication) to be safe; causatively, to free or succor

3.brief: properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
strictly nothingness; also trouble. vanity, wickedness; specifically an idol
toil, i.e. wearing effort; hence, worry, wheth. of body or mind
to scan, i.e. look intently at; by implication, to regard with pleasure, favor or care
violence; by implication, wrong; by meton. unjust gain
a front, i.e. part opposite; specifically a counterpart, or mate; usually (adverbial, especially with preposition) over against or before
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
to lift, in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, absolute and relative

4.brief: above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)
a precept or statute, especially the Decalogue or Pentateuch
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to go (causatively, bring) out, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively, direct and proxim.

properly, a goal, i.e. the bright object at adistance travelled towards; hence (figuratively), splendor, or (subjectively) truthfulness, or (objectively) confidence; but usually (adverbially), continually (i.e. to the most distant point of view)

properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
to enclose; hence (in a friendly sense) to crown, (in a hostile one) to besiege; also to wait (as restraining oneself)
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)
to go (causatively, bring) out, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively, direct and proxim.

properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style

5.brief: to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts
to scan, i.e. look intently at; by implication, to regard with pleasure, favor or care
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to do or make (systematically and habitually), especially to practise
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to build up or support; to foster as a parent or nurse; figuratively to render (or be) firm or faithful, to trust or believe, to be permanent or quiet; morally to be true or certain;
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
properly, to score with a mark as a tally or record, i.e. (by implication) to inscribe, and also to enumerate; intensively, to recount, i.e. celebrate

6.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to rise (in various applications, literal, figurative, intensive and causative)
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
a Kasdite, or descendant of Kesed; by implication, a Chaldaean (as if so descended); also an astrologer (as if proverbial of that people
a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts
bitter (literally or figuratively); also (as noun) bitterness, or (adverbially) bitterly
properly, to be liquid or flow easily, i.e. (by implication); to hurry (in a good or a bad sense); often used (with another verb) adverbially, promptly
to walk (in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively)
enlargement, either literally (an open space, usually in a good sense), or figuratively (liberty)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
to occupy (by driving out previous tenants, and possessing in their place); by implication, to seize, to rob, to inherit; also to expel, to impoverish, to ruin
a residence (including a shepherd's hut, the lair of animals, figuratively, the grave; also the Temple); specifically, the Tabernacle (properly, its wooden walls)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

7.brief: to fear; morally, to revere; caus. to frighten

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses

properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style
an elevation or leprous scab; figuratively, elation or cheerfulness; exaltation in rank or character
to go (causatively, bring) out, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively, direct and proxim.

8.brief: to be (causatively, make) light, literally (swift, small, sharp, etc.) or figuratively (easy, trifling, vile, etc.)
a horse (as leaping); also a swallow (from its rapid flight)
to be (causatively, make) sharp or (figuratively) severe
a steed (as stretched out to a vehicle, not single nor for mounting ); also (by implication) a driver (in a chariot), i.e. (collectively) cavalry
a steed (as stretched out to a vehicle, not single nor for mounting ); also (by implication) a driver (in a chariot), i.e. (collectively) cavalry
remote, literally or figuratively, of place or time; specifically, precious; often used adverbially (with preposition)
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
to fly; also (by implication of dimness) to faint (from the darkness of swooning)
the eagle (or other large bird of prey)
to hurry; figuratively, to be eager with excitement or enjoyment

9.brief: properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
violence; by implication, wrong; by meton. unjust gain
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
properly, accumulation, i.e. impulse or direction
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
the fore or front part; hence (by orientation) the East (often adverbially, eastward, for brevity the east wind)
to gather for any purpose; hence, to receive, take away, i.e. remove (destroy, leave behind, put up, restore, etc.)
exiled; captured; as noun, exile (abstractly or concretely and collectively); by extension, booty

10.brief: he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
probably to be heavy, i.e. (figuratively) honorable

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a fortification, castle, or fortified city; figuratively, a defender
to laugh (in pleasure or detraction); by implication, to play
dust (as powdered or gray); hence, clay, earth, mud
to catch (in a net, trap or pit); generally, to capture or occupy; also to choose (by lot); figuratively, to cohere

11.brief: at that time or place; also as a conjunction, therefore
properly, to slide by, i.e. (by implication) to hasten away, pass on, spring up, pierce or change

wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions)
to cross over; used very widely of any transition (literal or figurative; transitive, intransitive, intensive, causative); specifically, to cover (in copulation)
to be guilty; by implication to be punished or perish
vigor, literally (force, in a good or a bad sense) or figuratively (capacity, means, produce); also (from its hardiness) a large lizard

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative

12.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
the front, of place (absolutely, the fore part, relatively the East) or time (antiquity); often used adverbially (before, anciently, eastward)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
sacred (ceremonially or morally); (as noun) God (by eminence), an angel, a saint, a sanctuary
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to die (literally or figuratively); causatively, to kill
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style
to put (used in a great variety of applications, literal, figurative, inferentially, and elliptically)
properly, a cliff (or sharp rock, as compressed); generally, a rock or boulder; figuratively, a refuge; also an edge (as precipitous)
to be right (i.e. correct); reciprocal, to argue; causatively, to decide, justify or convict
to set (literally or figuratively); intensively, to found; reflexively, to sit down together, i.e. settle, consult

13.brief: an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)
to scan, i.e. look intently at; by implication, to regard with pleasure, favor or care
near, with or among; often in general, to
toil, i.e. wearing effort; hence, worry, wheth. of body or mind
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to be able, literally (can, could) or morally (may, might)

properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
to scan, i.e. look intently at; by implication, to regard with pleasure, favor or care
to cover (with a garment); figuratively, to act covertly; by implication, to pillage

to scratch, i.e. (by implication) to engrave, plough; hence (from the use of tools) to fabricate (of any material); figuratively, to devise (in a bad sense); hence (from the idea of secrecy) to be silent, to let alone; hence (by implication) to be deaf (as an accompaniment of dumbness)
to make away with (specifically by swallowing); generally, to destroy
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses

14.brief: to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)

a sea (as breaking in noisy surf) or large body of water; specifically (with the article), the Mediterranean Sea; sometimes a large river, or an artifical basin; locally, the west, or (rarely) the south
a reptile or any other rapidly moving animal
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

15.brief: properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
to ascend, intransitively (be high) or actively (mount); used in a great variety of senses, primary and secondary, literal and figurative
to drag off roughly; by implication, to bring up the cud (i.e. ruminate); by analogy, to saw
physical (as shutting in) a net (either literally or figuratively); usually a doomed object; abstractly extermination
to gather for any purpose; hence, to receive, take away, i.e. remove (destroy, leave behind, put up, restore, etc.)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)
probably to brighten up, i.e. (figuratively) be (causatively, make) blithe or gleesome
properly, to spin round (under the influence of any violent emotion), i.e. usually rejoice, or (as cringing) fear

16.brief: above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)
to slaughter an animal (usually in sacrifice)
physical (as shutting in) a net (either literally or figuratively); usually a doomed object; abstractly extermination
to smoke, i.e. turn into fragrance by fire (especially as an act of worship)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
properly, smoothness (of the tongue); also an allotment
an eatable (includ. provender, flesh and fruit)

properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)
to pour out (literally or figuratively), i.e. empty

a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts
